Package jpacman.model

This package contains the pacman model: i.e., it contains representations for cells, monsters, the player, the board, the game, etc.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Board Maintain a rectangular board of cells, potentially occupied by guests.
Cell A Cell keeps track of its (x,y) position on the board, and the potential Guest occupying the Cell.
Engine The top level state machine, which also acts as interface to the viewer (which observes the state machine) and the controller (which triggers the state machine events).
Food Food having a number of calories, which can occupy a cell on the board.
Game Representation of the board and its guests.
GameLoader Take care of loading a map of a game from a resource file.
Guest Class containing responsibilities shared by all Guests.
Monster A monster on the board.
Move A potential move from one cell to another.
MovingGuest Type for guests with moving capabilities.
Player The player which can walk around on the board, eat food, and die when meeting a monster.
PlayerMove Class to represent the effects of moving the player.
Wall A wall positioned on a cell on the board.
 

Exception Summary
GameLoadException Representation of things that can go wrong when loading games / maps from file.
 

Package jpacman.model Description

This package contains the pacman model: i.e., it contains representations for cells, monsters, the player, the board, the game, etc. The top level class is Engine, which keeps track of the state of the game, and which implements the Facade design pattern -- offering an interface to the controller classes.

Version:
